StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [DeleteProspectAsvabFromMcriss]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@MarineCandidateID int ,@Version varchar(3) ,@AsvabDate date.me
AS BEGIN
-- STEP 1: Start the transac.on BEGIN TRANSACTION
DECLARE @ProspectID uniqueiden..er
SELECT Top 1 @ProspectID = ProspectId FROM USMC.Prospect WHERE NwaId IN (SELECT rowguid FROM MCRISS.dbo.NWA WHERE MARINE_CANDIDATE_ID = @MarineCandidateID)
IF @ProspectID IS NOT NULL BEGIN
DECLARE @ID uniqueiden..er
SELECT @ID = ID FROM USMC.ProspectAsvab WHERE [ProspectID] = @ProspectID AND [Version] = @Version AND YEAR([ExamDate]) = YEAR(@AsvabDate) AND MONTH([ExamDate]) = MONTH(@AsvabDate) AND DAY([ExamDate]) = DAY(@AsvabDate) AND DATEPART(hour,[ExamDate]) = DATEPART(hour,@AsvabDate) AND DATEPART(minute,[ExamDate]) = DATEPART(minute,@AsvabDate) AND DATEPART(second,[ExamDate]) = DATEPART(second,@AsvabDate)
-- STEP 2 & 3: Issue the data change statement(s), checking @@ERROR a.er each statement IF @ID IS NOT NULL BEGIN DELETE FROM [PROSPECTING].[USMC].[ProspectAsvab] WHERE ID = @ID
END END -- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- STEP 4: If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully -- Commit the transac.on.... COMMIT TRANSACTION
END
